titleStmt.title: Leonard Martin v. Washington Territory. Warrant of Arrest

bibl.title: Leonard Martin v. Washington Territory. Warrant of Arrest
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: United States of America Territory of Washington 3rd Judicial District }ss
The President of the United States of America to the Marshal of the United States of said District greeting

Whereas Complaint has been made upon the oath of JGClingen to intermstial before James G Swan a Commisioner of the District Court of the United States in and In and District that one Leonard Martin late of said district did on the first day of May 1885 sell and dispose of intocicating liqors to and within the city of Port Townsend country to the port of the Statute in such cases made and provide and against the pace and deputy of the United States

There and therfore of Command you to apprehend the said Leonard Martin and bring him before me at my office on the port forth day of May AD 1885 a 2 O'Clock PM to a the premisse and furthern to be dealt with according to law In United States of I have hereto set my hand this first day of May AD 1885
James G Swan USCommision 3 Judicial Dist WT

I reserve the within warrant this 1st day of May AD 1885 and proceeded forthwith to arrest the within named Leonard Martin and bring him into Court this 1st day of May AB 1885 before Hon JG Swan US Commisioner.
G W George US Marshal By JG Clinger Deputy
WT Commison Court James G Sworn Commision United States vs Leonard Martin}
Warrant of Arrest Returned of Sted May 1st 1885 James G Sworn Commission Commfine James Warrant $1.00 Fiting 10 $1.10
Marshals fees'Services Warrant - $2.00 Attending on Court 2.00 Commiting 50. Ksllasing 2 Witness Humpbalek Billy & Annie his wife on bail 1.00 $5.50
